abstract: Toyota has been advertising heavily during the Olympics, offering an apology while seeking to repair its tarnished reputation.
snippet: Toyota has been advertising heavily during the Olympics, offering an apology while seeking to repair its tarnished reputation.
lead_paragraph: AMID the halfpipes, triple axels and doubled triple lutzes of the Vancouver Games, viewers are being treated to quite a feat: a corporate bend-over-backward.

headline.main: Toyota Uses Olympic Ads to Seek Redemption
headline.print_headline: Seeking Redemption On an Olympic Stage

abstract: Toyota’s president offered several steps aimed at restoring trust in the embattled Japanese automaker.
snippet: Toyota’s president offered several steps aimed at restoring trust in the embattled Japanese automaker.
lead_paragraph: TOKYO  Toyota’s president, Akio Toyoda, offered several steps Wednesday aimed at restoring trust in the embattled Japanese automaker, including installation of a new brake-override systems in future models and quicker disclosure of defects.

headline.main: Toyota Announces Steps to Restore Confidence on Safety

byline.original: By Hiroko Tabuchi and Nick Bunkley

abstract: Wall Street investors, buoyed by signs of stability in the housing and manufacturing sectors, seemed optimistic about the speed of economic renewal on Wednesday as worries about mounting debt burdens abroad began to subside, The New York Times reported.
snippet: Wall Street investors, buoyed by signs of stability in the housing and manufacturing sectors, seemed optimistic about the speed of economic renewal on Wednesday as worries about mounting debt burdens abroad began to subside, The New York Times rep...
lead_paragraph: Wall Street investors, buoyed by signs of stability in the housing and manufacturing sectors, seemed optimistic about the speed of economic renewal on Wednesday as worries about mounting debt burdens abroad began to subside.

headline.main: Shares Improve on Growing Signs of a Recovery

abstract: Akio Toyoda accepted an invitation to testify at a hearing next week in the aftermath of the recall of millions of cars.
snippet: Akio Toyoda accepted an invitation to testify at a hearing next week in the aftermath of the recall of millions of cars.
lead_paragraph: DETROIT  The president of Toyota, Akio Toyoda, agreed on Thursday to appear before Congress next week to discuss the recall of millions of vehicles for sudden acceleration problems. The move puts him squarely in position for the first time as the company’s chief advocate in Washington.

headline.main: Toyota Chief Agrees to Testify Before House Panel
headline.print_headline: Toyota Chief Agrees to Testify About Recalls Before a Congressional Panel

byline.original: By Nick Bunkley and Micheline Maynard
